data.title: Saving an untitled file is not showing the prompt
data.body:
Testing #34696

- Create a new Untitled file
- Save the file. ( I used `cmd+s`)

No dialog appears

data.title: WebView find widget: match case, match whole world, regular expression
data.body:
Refs: #33296

We shuold also support match case, match whole word, regulard expression in the web view find widget. Just like in the editor.
Mostly for consistency so these two experiences are not so much different

data.title: Settings: putting something outside the settings node should show warning
data.body:
Somehow the validation does not seem to kick in properly:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/900690/30857014-82035fc0-a2ba-11e7-9886-5fb13e9f4d48.png)

data.title: Webview findwidget: floating gray with no border or shadow does not work
data.body:
Refs: #33296

Notice that the current web view find widget uses gray color with no border or shadow. This way it seems to be floating/
This works in the editor since it has a shadow and since it is docked to the top of the editor.
The current web view solution simply does not aestheticaly work for me

fyi @stevencl 

![screen shot 2017-09-26 at 12 55 54](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1926584/30856881-157eea4a-a2ba-11e7-8dc7-53b59581cf28.png)

data.title: FindWidget navigate shortcuts not working in WebViews
data.body:
Refs: #33296

OS X

1. Notice how you can use F3 and Shift F3 to find next / previous in editor find widget
2. Notice how this is not working when find widget is invoked in Web Views (terminal, extension, md preview)
3. No other find widget keyboard shortcut works for me

data.title: Region suggestions are not shown when typing region
data.body:
Testing #34989

- Type `//`
- Trigger intelli-sense
- Type `reg`

You do not see proposals for regions

![kapture 2017-09-26 at 12 52 09](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10746682/30856778-b375c4d6-a2b9-11e7-9c3f-312222747e9a.gif)

data.title: Keybindings input not remembered
data.body:
1. Preferences > keyboard shortucts > type something
2. Open some other editor, go back to keyboard shortucts -> input is cleared
3. This does not align with our general UX story where we try to preserve as much UX state as possible

data.title: [css] accept selectors in ::slotted()

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: v1.16.1
- OS Version: macOS Sierra v10.12.6
<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
- Reproduces without extensions: Yes

Steps to Reproduce:

1. For example, write the next valid code in a CSS language mode:

```css
::slotted(div:hover) {
  color: red;
}
```

2. See the alerts.
![screen shot 2017-09-26 at 12 14 51](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1007051/30856255-16462c4c-a2b8-11e7-9a73-e5e05c71ebe0.png)

Reference: https://github.com/w3c/webcomponents/issues/655

data.title: gray'ish workspace folders
data.body: #34775 * on mac * have a workspace with a few folders * open the workspace file and change the path of a few folder to non existing files/folders * üêõ the folders show gray'ish, I'd expect them to disappear, optionally to see a squiggle in the config file

data.title: [css] Wrong intellisense inside @supports clause
data.body:
Testing #34994

Notice how Intellisense is suggesting properties inside a `@supports` clause, when it should expect selectors instead:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22350/30856347-5ce9265e-a2b8-11e7-9720-92abc0889380.png)

data.title: Syntax error when using `not` in @supports clause
[css] no intellisense inside @supports condition
Tasks: show task log action should take terminal into account
data.body:
Refs: #34953

We have a Tasks: show task log which always opens the output. However this can be wrong if my tasks are running in the terminal.

We should either remove this action and only use "Show running tasks", or make this action smarter that it opens the terminal if no task is appending output to the output channel

data.title: Terminal Output incorrectly rendered for IEx help
data.body:
When using Elixir's Interactive Shell the help headings for functions is incorrectly formatted. It should be a yellow bar with black letters to indicate the name of the function, instead it is a shortened, non-contiguous bar with no text.

- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.17.0-insider (f7962f0682a76516df51de4856f8ccc5d8ad578a, 2017-09-20T05:10:59.524Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.7.0
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
vscode-markdownlint|Dav|0.10.1
EditorConfig|Edi|0.10.1
material-icon-theme|PKi|2.2.1
vscode-docker|Pet|0.0.18
code-settings-sync|Sha|2.8.3
better-toml|bun|0.3.1
vscode-eslint|dba|1.3.2
vscode-babel-coloring|dza|0.0.4
gitlens|eam|5.2.0
rest-client|hum|0.15.2
terraform|mau|0.0.18
vscode-elixir|mjm|1.0.0
prettify-json|moh|0.0.3
cpptools|ms-|0.12.4
elm|sbr|0.15.0
vscode-nginx|sha|0.4.1
vim|vsc|0.10.1

(3 theme extensions excluded)


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open terminal
2. Launch `iex`
3. Run `h String.split/1`

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

See the video

data.title: 'How to contribute' out of date?
data.body:
I have forked the project and am following the 'how to contribute'  guide to try and compile on Windows. On running `npm run watch`, I receive the error `'gulp' is not recognised...`. A little research suggests that this is a node package, which has to be installed globally before use in a project (https://semaphoreci.com/community/tutorials/getting-started-with-gulp-js, 'Gulp installation').

Have I missed something, or should the guide be updated in order to include this step?

data.title: TypeScript should allow to disable watch and build task detection seperately
data.body:
Testing #34992

- have a workspace with a tsconfig.json file
- Tasks > Run Task

You get a build and watch task which is great. However I would like to disable the build task auto detection since I would always prefer watch over build.

data.title: Tasks: consider using folder name for terminal drop down
data.body:
Refs: #34953

1. Multi folder workspace
2. Run some task, notice that the title showed in the terminal drop down only has the task name
3. I suggest to aslo include the folder name in brackets (since we can not style here) after the task name

This is what we are currently doing in launch.json dropdown so it would be both for consistency and clarity.

data.title: SCM: repositories are not sorted by order of the workspace config file
data.body:
Testing: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/34963

It seems that the order I define in workspace file is not reflected in the sorting order of the repository view:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/900690/30855887-c9d9c8e2-a2b6-11e7-8ac9-82ef20ea672d.png)

I changed the order while the SCM view was opened. `test-ts` and `test-js` are not in the order as defined.

data.title: task list still shows a root name with bracket
data.body:
Refs: #34953

1. Multi folder repository
2. Quick open > task 
3. Notice the task list presented here shows the folder names in brackets
4. Notice that the folder names are not shown in brackets for any other task UI, it seems like you forgot it for the Task quick open entry

![screen shot 2017-09-26 at 12 26 40](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1926584/30855742-43655e5c-a2b6-11e7-906a-d95012c11eb3.png)

data.title: Default name for showSaveDialog when using filters is wrong
data.body:
Testing #34821 on macOS

I call the API so:

```ts
window.showSaveDialog({ filters: { 'TypeScript': ['*.ts'] }});
```

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22350/30855564-ba46e12c-a2b5-11e7-9593-85f83a47a060.png)

data.title: Filters don't work in showOpenDialog
data.body:
Testing #34821 on macOS

As soon as I add `filters: { 'TypeScript': ['*.ts'] }` to the options of `showOpenDialog`, I can no longer select any files, including `*.ts` files.

data.title: Confusing syntax in API docs
data.body:
Testing #34821

https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/vscode.d.ts#L1541

It uses this syntax:

```ts
{
	['Images']: ['*.png', '*.jpg']
	['TypeScript']: ['*.ts', '*.tsx']
}
```

When this would be simpler:

```ts
{
	'Images': ['*.png', '*.jpg']
	'TypeScript': ['*.ts', '*.tsx']
}
```

data.title: Can't open single file anymore if contained in folder workspace
data.body:
- have a folder workspace
- open a terminal
- navigate to the folder workspace location
- go into a sub directory
- code .\xxx.yy

Observe: the folder workspace opens not the single file.

data.title: Improve bad defaultUri argument to `showOpenDialog`
data.body:
Testing #34821

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22350/30855030-c7c23196-a2b3-11e7-96ee-fb5e53c5027f.png)

Maybe the error message should indicate which `bad path` it refers to. Or maybe just ignore it, if it's bad and continue as if no URI was passed.

data.title: Generated launch.json doesn't reflect my workspace content
Missing "hide" on second headers
data.body:
re #34963

In our collapsable views we can always hide them using the context menu. I am aware that we re-purposed that view but I still miss it
